Game.Name: Psycho Pinball (Europe) (En,Fr,De,Es,It) (October 1994)
Game.plot: Overview:Psycho Pinball is a pinball game developed and published by Codemasters for the Genesis and PC platforms.Gameplay:The game features for 4 tables, Wild West, The Abyss, Halloween, and Amusement Park.Wild WestThe map features a mini-game that is a simple form of black jack, where you have a one-shot chance at guessing if you have a better hand than the "dealer" and win loads of points.The AbyssHalloweenAmusement ParkThe Amusement park is special in that it has the ability to transfer the player into the any of the other 3 tables with all the special bonuses they include, for 1 round. Failing in any of these transfered tables will not cause you to lose a ball, but will return you to the Amusement table, where, if you are able can transfer to any of the other 3 tables.It is also the hardest with the least bonuses outside the transfer ability.The game has a score limit, easily obtained via the Amusement park of 999.999.999 points simply because the games counter stops counting at 9 digits.Cheat: Extra ballTo get an extra ball pause the game and press Down, B, C, B, Right, Right.Cheat: Extra ballTo get a free ride at any time during the game, pause and press: C, A, C, A, B, Up, B.Cheat: Extra ball To play the minigamess at any time during the game press: B, A, B, B, A, C, A, C.
Game.Notes: Psycho Pinball is a 1994 pinball video game published and developed by Codemasters, released for the Sega Mega Drive in the United Kingdom, and MS-DOS personal computers in the United States and Europe. There are four differently themed tables; Wild West (American Old West), Trick or Treat (Halloween), The Abyss (Caribbean underwater), and finally Psycho (an amusement park). While the first three are regular tables, Psycho broke new ground; it is connected to the others by activating certain jumpers, then launching the ball into one of the tents, and the ball continues in the other table, returning to drop from the tent in Psycho when it drains. It is also the only one with a spring ball launcher and no multiball (presumably because of the potential for one of the balls to transition between tables).
